message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $11,500.  It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll find it valuable.  Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $10,500. I really like the product, but I'm on a tight budget. Can we meet in the middle?
Bob, I understand you're on a budget, but $10,500 is just too low for me.  How about we split the difference and go with $11,000?  That way we both get a fair deal. Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to go up to $10,750, but no more. Can you meet me there?

Bob, I'm really trying to work with you here, but $10,750 is still a little too low for me.  I'm willing to come down to $11,250.  This is a fair price that allows us both to make a profit.  What do you say?
I understand you're trying to make a profit, but I'm really trying to keep costs down. I'm willing to go up to $10,900, but that's as high as I can go. Can you meet me there?
